website_summaries.verdict: With options for a variety of page markings, this softcover notebook is great for bullet journaling or other creative uses.
pros: Choice of blank, dotted, graphed, or lined pages
thick cover made of recycled paper
Binding is sewn and glued for flexibility
cons: Dots and grids may not always line up across the pages

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bullet journal
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Great for an easy to carry bullet journal. The covers are soft, but that's fine with me as I can decorate them myself if I need to reinforce them ever. The dot grid lines up fine (saw complaints about that on a different book when researching, not a problem here), and the pages are nice and thick. Minimal ghosting and I only have bleeding a tiny bit when I color. Fountain pens do feather a little, but very minimal ghosting and no bleed (unless coloring), so I can live with that. Overall I'm really loving the books and will definitely buy more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Profile Name

customer_reviews.title: Excellence all around
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and a perfect size, this notebook is everything I hoped it would be for my first bullet journal. The notebook lays nicely and has held up nicely through a conference where I carried it around in a packed bag. There are also a good number of pages, so it may be awhile, but I will be purchasing more of these Northbooks!
customer_reviews.author: V. Oatis

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is such a well made notebook. I got it to use as a bullet planner for class and binding is nice and flexable which lets me push it flat to draw/write. It holds ink fairly well with slight feathering for heavy inks like fountain pens and thick brush pens. There is little bleed through to the next page, though some marker type pens showed through more than other, which I included a picture of. I like these a lot and will definitely be getting a few more for note taking.
customer_reviews.author: mdhendricks

customer_reviews.title: For people who like sheen and shading
customer_reviews.text: The paper absorbs ink very fast, without bleeding through or feathering. For people who like sheen and shading, that's probably not what you want to hear. (But then again shading and fast dry times are opposing design goals) On the other hand : you'll never have to worry about smearing what you just wrote or bother with blotter paper. Really my only issue is that due to the thickness of the pages it's impossible to to lay the notebook flat, especially towards the middle. There will be always that curve on either side of the binding that you can't use without holding the pen at awkward angles.
customer_reviews.author: jh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for BuJo!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheaper dot grid notebook and came across this one. I decided to try it out and I'm so glad I did! I'm just starting my first bullet journal and this will be perfect. The pages lay flat, the grid dots are all perfectly aligned, and my felt tip Papermate Flair pens don't bleed through. You can see the writing on the back of a page but not enough to bother me and considering the pens I use, I'm very pleased! High quality without the high price.
customer_reviews.author: Holly B.

customer_reviews.title: Not the same notebook!
customer_reviews.text: Not the same notebook. This is my second time purchasing northbooks and I was very pleased with the durability of the slightly waxed cover which was durable and resisted tearing even with heavy daily use. I liked paying slightly more to support Made in USA product/company with quality notebooks. The new notebooks I purchased in May 2020 for the same price have a non waxed completely different feeling cover and one of the corners was already bent on arrival. Disappointed that Northbooks cheapened the cardstock cover. It seems like it will not hold up and look presentable with use. I will not buy this version again
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the savings
customer_reviews.text: After spending $19 on the classic Leuchtturm bullet journal, I decided to save $10 and buy this journal instead. After all, I could write my own page numbers and index pages, etc, now that I knew the bullet journal routine. Unfortunately, the pages in this journal don't stay open no matter what I do. That's my main complaint. Plus I miss the ribbon bookmarks and other amenities in the Leuchtturm. So I'll be shelling out the extra money for that purchase next time.
customer_reviews.author: City Gal

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed using this notebook. I filled it up a while ago, actually! But I still reference it quite often. The cover did not hold up very well, but I did use it very heavily. I carry it with me every day for about 15 months, and the cover just is not durable enough for that. So, that is the only reason I did not repurchase this. I loved it so much; it was my first dot notebook, and the color of the cover and the color of the pages is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I've recently started bullet journaling and I got these books due to the excellent reviews! They do not disappoint so far! The dots are light enough that they don't distract from my entries and the paper is thick, with no bleeding through of the pens I got! The paper is also very sturdy, easily allowing for me to reposition washi tape when it doesn't look straight. Great buy, wish there were more colors to chose from!
customer_reviews.author: graciekata123

customer_reviews.title: I've bought a bunch of these.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these notebooks especially the dot grid layout. I did notice one 'feature', that I wasn't expecting but it's not consistent. Some of the pages have a very light perforation that makes it easy to tear out a page and leave a clean tear. But it's not on all pages, at least on my notebook. I'm splitting hears because I wasn't expecting it but now I know it's there I like it but it's not always there. That said, I will buy more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Great softcover notebook
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on sale, so I didn't have very high hopes, but these notebooks definitely exceeded my expectations! These were a lot sturdier than I thought they would be and the spine did not break regardless of how much abuse I put these through (and I'm pretty rough on my notebooks). The dot grid was evenly printed on each page and there was surprisingly no bleed-through and very little ghosting with Lamy ink. I appreciated the tearaway pages in the back. Per personal preference I'll stick to hardcovers from now on, but if you're in the market for a softcover notebook these are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quite satisfied, will buy again
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this notebook. The pages are a soft cream so you aren't blinded by bright white, and the pages are thick enough that for the most part I don't notice any bleed from the back of the page. I use a pilot G-2 pen, as any decent person should, and there is just a little that shows through. I'm sure if you use a free ball point pen from the bank it wouldn't show at all. The spine was slightly bent at some point (I'm guessing during shipping), so it's not 100% perfect (nothing ever is). However I will keep buying this notebook because it meets all my picky requirements!
customer_reviews.author: ConiferousCentaur

customer_reviews.title: My perfect notebook
customer_reviews.text: These are by far my favorite daily use notebook. I am extremely particular about notebooks (I’m not proud of it), this notebook checks all of the boxes. The dots are a wonderful guide but not too dark. The cover is sturdy but flexible. Perfect to keep a pen in. My only complaint is that I now have a stack of unusable other notebooks that can’t compare to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mattso5

customer_reviews.title: Great Notebook for a Bullet Journal
customer_reviews.text: This is a great notebook! I'm using it to create a bullet journal and have been very pleased with it. The pages do bleed through a little bit, though it's not too noticeable; where it has been worst is if on one side of the page I'm creating a tracker where I fill in a box with a pen and the other side I have another tracker that I fill in with a highlighter, it gets some bleed through (which I think is to be expected). It's a small and compact book. I do wish it had a bookmark on it and maybe a nicer/studier cover but I knew it didn't have those things going into it.
customer_reviews.author: Kickingoose13

customer_reviews.title: Lovely notebook. Meets all my expectations wonderfully!
customer_reviews.text: Loving this notebook! Holds up very well to multiple ink tests with only the wettest and sharpies bleeding through. Very impressed with this humble notebook! Would love to see future editions adding bookmarks and pockets to back cover and possibly more pages 😉🙏🏼. Overall meets all my hopes for this notebook and has been wonderful for bullet journaling! Would definitely purchase again! Instagram @jensprettylittlepaints
customer_reviews.author: Jen Jen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’m actually pretty disappointed with this purchase. I have a Northbooks notebook that I used for bullet journaling throughout 2019 and it was great, my markers didn’t bleed through the pages and the dots all lined up nicely. So I thought I’d buy more for 2020, however it seems as though the quality has changed. The pages are thinner and my exact same markers are now bleeding through, making everything look messy and the dots don’t match up through the whole journal. I don’t want to waste this notebook that I’ve already started setting up for 2020, but I can’t help but be super disappointed in how it’s turning out.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Smith

customer_reviews.title: Details of this Journal
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this notebook! Nice stitched binding. Looks like it will hold together. Nice sized pages - a little wider than a moleskin, which is great. Nice rounded corners. Grid lines up across he pages. Ivory pages which are easier on the eyes than start white. More pages than my Moleskin to lechturm. Paper seems like nice quality. Cover is like heavy card stock which is why I gave it 4 stars- I'd prefer something a little nicer. Planning to decorate it. No ribbon marker. Made in America! The price is awesome. Definitely will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Northboooks are the best notebooks hands down.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for journaling. If you want these to be notebooks for class, I recommend buying their B5 sized notebooks. I added a picture comparing the two sizes. I absolutely love these notebooks. Great paper quality and I’m convinced that I will never buy another brand of notebooks ever again in my life. Do yourself a favor. BUY THIS BRAND! I use these notebooks for my half semester classes but I found that they honestly have plenty of pages to work for a full semester or even a year depending on how many notes you take.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Russmann

customer_reviews.title: A nice little dot grid book
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent book for a bullet journal! It's perfectly sized, small enough to be portable but big enough to fit everything I need on a page. The dot grid is easily visible but doesn't disrupt whatever you draw on top of it, and the paper is thick enough that even bold colored pens don't bleed through. Overall, I'm quite happy with this little book, and plan to buy several backups.
customer_reviews.author: J. Betz

customer_reviews.title: No customer support from Northbooks
customer_reviews.text: Items came ripped even though they were in plastic packaging. I tried contacting Northbooks to get an exchange since they then upped the price, but didn't get a reply. I actually still haven't even got a reply and it's been over a week.The journal itself although it says softcover is really just paper with a waxy feel. Mediocre product along with no customer service I'm pretty disappointed. I ended up buying the two pack miliko dot grid a5 notebooks and they've been pretty good. I feel they provide more value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Cuevas

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and well-built notebook. MADE IN THE U.S.A.
customer_reviews.text: This notebook is very nice, the quality of paper and manufacturing is very high, the gray cover looks very good. I would only give an advice to Northbooks, but I am just a customer, I wouldn' t like to give a wrong advice, They know the market and everything, not me... Just, as a customer, I would like to find bigger notebooks from them, like A4, some 11-12 inches tall and 8 to 9 inches wide... for sometimes I need large notebooks, and I have to switch to other companies, some of them build in the USA as well, so...
customer_reviews.author: Roberto F.

customer_reviews.title: Great journaling book for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price you are paying, this notebook isn’t half bad. I’m starting to journal and I thought this bullet paged one would work. I wanted the pages thick enough and I’ve been using paper mate flair and uniball vision to write in it and there is no bleeding and minimal fading on the pages. Wish the cover was a bit more flexible as the inside cover is straight paper but it has a nice feel and looks good. Gets the job of journaling done well.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Torres

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Lacks Features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this notebook to try out as my work notebook. And I love it for that purpose. The paper is a good quality and has no ghosting from ball point pens. And minimal ghosting from my Staedtler Fineliners. But it lacks features like a closure band, ribbon marker, and back pocket. At the price, I could deal with the lack of a ribbon and closure band. Afterall, I can just use a paperclip and binder clip. But the lack of a back pocket makes it not fit my personal journal use case. If they added this feature, I'd be switching to this notebook.
customer_reviews.author: PurelyNicole

customer_reviews.title: Durable and professional
customer_reviews.text: Easily the best notebooks I have ever owned. Great for work or for bullet journaling. They are also VERY durable. I keep 2 of these in my bag and am always on the road. I use and abuse these (smash them with other things I'm throwing in the bag, bend the spine all the way back, keep a pen between the pages so I always have it) and they show almost no signs of wear (a few bent corners on pages where I've put something in the middle without realizing). I love my Northbooks Softcover Notebooks!
customer_reviews.author: Wine Girl

customer_reviews.title: good starter for bujo
customer_reviews.text: i love how sturdy and flexible the cover is since i've nearly abused it this past week. the pages are smooth, minimal ghosting and bleeding (see pics) a good starter notebook for bujo beginners like myself. the last couple of pages at the back are perforated. just wish the first few pages at the front are the same.. other than that, Im very satisfied with my purchase and will be looking forward to future products. I wish you would offer a filler paper for dots with reinforced holes it would be awesome for note taking in college.. esp for science and engineering courses.. thank u!
customer_reviews.author: Lgbg132812

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, fountain pen ink bleeds
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice, well made writing notebook. Sadly, just not for fountain pens. With a variety of inks, all bleed through. If I preferred other types of pen I would give it 5 stars. My wife certainly loves hers and she uses ballpoint pens. So if you are not planning on using a fountain pen, this is an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Tzamaz

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: This notebook is not as sturdy as it appears. Some of the pages are threatening to come out, and the grids are uneven. If I were a perfectionist, this would drive me crazy, but for now I'm just annoyed. I would not recommend buying if you plan to use it as a bujo or some other intensive activity.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza V

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Made in USA Notebooks
customer_reviews.text: These notebooks are awesome. I've been using a Pilot Metropolitan fountain pen on these with Noodler's Black ink and there can be some occasional bleed, but very little (if any; depends largely on how long you keep the pen tip on the paper). No bleed-through on the backs of pages. Dots are printed on the paper, so when you write the ink clearly shows up on top of the dots. Another plus is that the skin of the book has really nice texture. I'm not sure what the material is called, but it feels sort of like waxed leather rather than the usual paper feel. Very happy with these notebooks.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: I love the very neutral color and the feel of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very much enjoying these journals, I purchased the lined and dot grid in an A5 size and they fit perfectly in my Chic Sparrow A5 travelers notebook. I love the very neutral color and the feel of the cover and the inside pages. The pages are a good thickness. I journal in pencil and habit track with Micron or Papermate Flair and have not had a problem with either on the pages Most of all I love that it is a product made in the USA! Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CyndiH

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome little notebooks
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome little notebooks! They came just as described and pictured from the seller. The quality is just great and I have put my first one through the ringer, as it is my shop notebook for woodworking projects, and it has held up beautifully. The grid paper is fantastic for my projects sketches. I would certainly purchase additional items from this seller in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Deal

customer_reviews.title: Really good functionality and design.
customer_reviews.text: Would be 5 stars, but mine came a little scuffed up on the backside of the notebook so I have to remove 1 star. Its a good design, the way the cover and pages fold back and stay folded makes writing easy without having to deal with the metal spines in other notebooks, or the lack of flexibility in the spine of other notebooks. I would recommend this, and for functionality its a 5 star product, but you pay 11 bucks for a notebook you don't want it to be scuffed up when it comes in new, which is my only gripe. Despite this, I will order again, so that should say something in itself.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful books. The cover feel and looks amazing! I was so excited when I received them. However when I opened them I was a bit disappointed. Like others mentioned the dots on the paper don't match up. On one page there is a millimeter of space between the last column of dots and the edge but on other pages there is an extra column of dots that are cut off. Alignment of the pages were not done effectively before stitching. The pages feel soft and a good quality. It's not that easy to keep open unless you want to really work the spine.
customer_reviews.author: Monica T

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: These notebooks are perfect for note-taking! I use them in my college classes and feel confident they will keep my notes readable for years. They are perfect, especially for technical information that will be used regularly for many years. Acid free paper, no bleeding of ink. I've purchased these numerous times and always great quality. Notebooks open and lay flat with little prodding, making it easy to use the whole page.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE NOT PERFORATED!!
customer_reviews.text: Really, really unhappy with this purchase. While the notebooks themselves are fine for what they are, I was under the impression that I would be able to tear the pages out because it shows a picture of perforated pages in the notebook. However, only the last 20 pages or so are perforated. What good does that do me when I wanted a notebook with tear out pages for note-taking? I'm giving them to my boyfriend. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: I Miss Their Hardcovers
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this companies notebooks for years as a daily journal. I love that this particular item they make is made in the USA. Recently they stopped making the hardcover notebooks. These are okay, but I really wish they would bring back the hardcover one.
customer_reviews.author: Cranny

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight, Good Paper, Perfect for My Needs
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying out several new notebooks to compare to my habitual choices. Northbooks A5 size notebook came up on my Amazon radar and the price was attractive. After opening and evaluating the notebook I moved it up to next rotation because it feels comfortable weight-wise and the paper is good quality. I tested out the paper with a fine nib fountain pen and blue ink. There was no feathering or bleed through to the back of the page. Next order will be for a 2-pack as the pricing is considerably lower per notebook when purchasing two. I would recommend it to a friend - it's a good notebook at a value price.
customer_reviews.author: Boby F.

customer_reviews.title: I love Northbooks!
customer_reviews.text: This is my current go-to for bullet journaling. Soft off-white pages are easy on my eyes. Minimal bleed-through, even with fountain pen: about the same as Lechturm. I can put several in my oversized traveler's journal cover and keep separate books for things like gardening notes, or whatever. The only downsides, compared to that most popular bullet journal: no page numbering or index pages (easy enough to add). No ribbon marker, but also an easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: maggie

customer_reviews.title: This is my second Northbookbook - get yourself one!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Northbook - I highly recommend getting one of these dot journal books it is a phenomenal item for the price and I can't say enough about the quality. Absolutely get yourself one, they are great for bullet journaling doodling lettering whatever your forte is, definitely invest in one of these books - you won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: annabanana0810

customer_reviews.title: Give this little journal a chance.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice notebook. I’ve bought 6 of these journals. When I first bought it I was surprised by the cover quality. It’s a little bit of a construction paper feel but thicker. But, after using it as a note book to Jot down ideas for art and story ideas, I find it's really a notebook that is built for tossing in a bag and going about my day. Also it's made of recycled paper, which didn't even consider when I described the cover. Honestly, after using it for my needs, I love it and that's why I bought more. Plenty of pages, great quality, (give it a chance).
customer_reviews.author: Dgala

customer_reviews.title: Great Notebook
customer_reviews.text: I like the softcovers and I find the graph paper pages perfect for drawing, writing formulas, as well as general notes. I find these note books perfect for all the research I've been doing for my sci-fi novel "Deep Light" due out in 2019.
customer_reviews.author: BigDrM

customer_reviews.title: Cover and binding so terribly made
customer_reviews.text: How disappointing to use a notebook as a journal and realize within a week of use that the paper cover on both the front and back are tearing away from the binding. I’ve used a half dozen journals and this is the worst manufactured. Now I’ll copy what I’ve written in this notebook and put it where it belongs — in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Denis S.

customer_reviews.title: Positively perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a long time for a life long lasting notebook cover such as this that is seamlessly smooth, no strings, no extra buckles to scratch my phone or glasses and this is it! I am over the moon with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa S.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Notebook - Great with fountain pens
customer_reviews.text: So far, a great buy! After writing notes for a class using two different fountain pens, with two different inks, I'm very pleased with the quality of the paper. Heavy use of ink did not bleed through pages and both inks were absorbed quickly by the paper without any feathering! For now, I highly recommend these notebooks and plan to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Turner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bullet Journal
customer_reviews.text: I have just learned about bullet journaling and I applied myself to set it up when this came in. It is perfect for this type of journaling. I love the simplicity of it and the dots in this journal are the right spacing for my size handwriting. It is just the right size to take with me everywhere with a soft, durable cover. The only thing I wish is that it had pre-printed page numbers but it isn't a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Lumynara

customer_reviews.title: Great Notebooks
customer_reviews.text: They are great. My only issue was that they were smaller than I was expecting, but that's my fault for not paying attention. I ended up ordering the larger (light brown) size as well since those are my favorite. Love these notebooks and have used them for work for years!
customer_reviews.author: Keshia Graese

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: It would've gotten 5 stars if it had the bookmark like the brand I usually get. I had to trim it to fit in my refillable journal. It's nice to know I have a secondary choice of such a needed product that is so well made, when "my usual" is out of stock
customer_reviews.author: Revelyn

customer_reviews.title: but not hardcover nice since I wanted to see if I could get ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what to expect when I ordered this. I wanted something nicer than a spiral notebook, but not hardcover nice since I wanted to see if I could get into the swing of bullet journaling and test out different layouts. This has been great for that. I knocked off a star because the grid dots don't line up throughout the entire notebook. I'd say 90% of the book lines up and the last 10% there is a few mm difference between pages lining up.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Marton

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: After failing to find a pre-made planner I enjoyed and found useful, I decided to delve into the world of Bujo. Northbooks A5 is absolutely perfect! From the soft cover to the dotted pages, I cannot complain. I've used it for a few weeks now mixing between pens, pencils and markers and have not had any bleedthrough. I can be a bit heavy handed sometimes and noticed slight shadowing, but I'm sure that's more of my own issue that a reflection of the notebook. All in all, I'll definitely be buying this again; especially for the great price for 2 packs!
customer_reviews.author: Juliet

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but lots of bleed through
customer_reviews.text: Very durable notebook. I have had trouble with bleed through using Copics (really bad), Tombow brush pens (bad), and Zebra Mildliners (noticeable, but workable). Other than that, the pages are smooth and lovely to write on. It seems capable of surviving almost anything and opens flat. I love it, but am a little bummed that so many things bleed through to the back of the page.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great basic notebook
customer_reviews.text: I recently received these, and they are just what I was looking for to use in journaling and taking notes. They lay flat, have minimal margins, college ruling, and the cream color is easy on the eyes. They fit perfectly in my Oberon cover, and on top of it all, are reasonably priced, made in the U.S., and have a recycled cover. The Clairefontaine journals did not flatten, and are more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Sundance

customer_reviews.title: Solid notebook but consider your usage.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first notebook for journaling / day planning. Works well for my needs. Might not make a good bullet journal. Bleed through is a definite issue for heavier inks. PROS: - Looks stylish - Cover and pages feel great in your hand - Dotted notebook has several advantages for me over lined or blank notebooks CONS: - Make sure your hands are CLEAN when handling the notebook. Not a slob but still managed to get fingerprints and smudges on the cover fairly easily - Too much bleed through for a Sharpie Ultra Fine pen. Use a roller gel pen instead - Cover has to be bent back substantially in order to write comfortably
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bullet journaling
customer_reviews.text: I am a notebook nerd and I love this notebook! Quality paper, perfect for bullet journaling! The size is perfect, the feel of it is right and I am very pleased with my purchase. You know how some notebooks feel "right" and some feel "cheap"???? This notebook just feels "right", ready for your deep and searching reflections, if you are into that kind of thing! Speaking as someone who has spent insane money on getting the perfect journal.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Olvera

customer_reviews.title: First time using a Northbook and I really like it. It's a nice size and the pages ...
customer_reviews.text: First time using a Northbook and I really like it. It's a nice size and the pages don't seem to bleed much when using sharpie pens. I'm using it for my first bullet journal and I can tell that I'll really enjoy it. I like it's simple but sleek binding and cover. More colors to choose from would be great, but who am I kidding? Gray is my favorite, lol! Definitely try it out if you're used to Moleskin or similar and want a change--and spend less money.
customer_reviews.author: Karla T

customer_reviews.title: The gridlines are perfect. The notebooks are small enough to be carried ...
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these notebooks for all my semester notes at grad school. The gridlines are perfect. The notebooks are small enough to be carried around easily but large enough to take full pages of notes and last a whole semester.
customer_reviews.author: maddiep

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Notebook for the Overly-Organized, Creatively Free Grad Student
customer_reviews.text: I started using a Dots notebook a few weeks ago at the beginning of my fall semester of graduate school. I had been searching for a specific planner fit for an overly-organized student, but there was nothing that really fit my needs or that wasn't crazy expensive. I'm using these notebooks as a day planner where I can write out my daily schedule, tasks for the day, as well as any notes I may need to write down. I really love the simplicity of the notebook and the dots allow me to use it for notes, drawing, and to keep track of my day. These notebooks have been exactly what I was looking for and at the right price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This journal is a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I am a journal connoisseur and this one is a keeper. The cover has a smooth, modern feel and the pages are substantial. It lays pretty flat so writing on the left hand side (when you're right handed) isn't too bad. I've yet to find a bound journal that does this perfectly and this one is close enough. I prefer the dotted grid style as I employ both words and drawings in my writing. And let's not forget -- MADE IN THE USA!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C.

customer_reviews.title: Love these - the paper quality is great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the paper quality so that I could use pens and not have the ink bleeding through and these worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that is not superb about this notebook is its cover, which is a regular quality soft paper-back, which would not protect from the water splashes or dirt. But considering the price, I'm willing to close my eyes om that flaw. Otherwise, its pages are made of exellent quality thick yellow (vintage looking) paper with light grids -- everything I need to fall in love with this notebook!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good quality bullet notebook and believe to had found it in this product. Only downside, I can exactly rip a page off without messing another one up. Moral: stop making mistakes :)
customer_reviews.author: QueenPanda

customer_reviews.title: NO perforated pages!
customer_reviews.text: For some reason this was listed when I searched for notebooks with perforated pages, but indeed it does NOT have perforated pages! Do not buy if you’re looking for a dotted notebook with perforated pages as you will be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I am not very fancy when it comes to using a bullet journal and this is the first one I bought but I am happy with it. Sharpie does show through the page, not really bleeds through but you can see mostly what I have written when I flip the page. Other pens don't bleed at all and work great. I like the spacing of the dots and using it is fun.
customer_reviews.author: HY

customer_reviews.title: Covers are thin and kind of shoddy for the quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Covers are thin and kind of shoddy for the quality of paper within. That being said, the paper inside is thick and does not bleed when I use a fountain pen. A+ But then the cover gets ruined, creased. Uglified in transport. Doesn't protect the first few pages so if you mess up and crease the cover, the otter pages may be ruined as well
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Quality Notebook
customer_reviews.text: I use notebooks daily and travel frequntly. Northbooks USA's Eco A5 Dotted Bullet Notebook/Sewn Journal is made of high quality paper, is reasonably price, is durable because of the sewn pages, and is the perfect size to carry with me wherever I go.
customer_reviews.author: L. Summers

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: These notebooks work very well for taking technical class notes. The ability to make your own structure for figures vs text is great. The pages are fairly thick for a cheap notebook so there's no bleed-through with my pens.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle S.

customer_reviews.title: Ideal.
customer_reviews.text: The perfect notebooks. I don't bullet journal, I just like to take a lot of notes. These are the perfect notebooks really, with only two minor items I'd note. 1. First few pages of writing (for a leftie as myself) can be slightly odd. Not really all that different from any other notebook. 2. I wish there was a much larger size. Very minor things, and I will keep buying these. Awesome feel to the cover as well.
customer_reviews.author: Battery Battery

customer_reviews.title: Great for school!
customer_reviews.text: Lastedme through the whole semester the cover of binding getting too worn down. Durable thick paper as well! All in all satisfied with this guy.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Thicc
customer_reviews.text: I like using fountain pens, and this notebook is very good for the amount of ink that can come out of my pens. Not like cheap notebooks, the ink does not bleed through the other side. Attached a picture of the backside of a page. Very hard to see the ink on the otherside of the page. Got nice thic pages. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: James Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great books - great price.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 4 books -- two with grid and two with dots. All were exactly as promised. Paper is a great weight and the binding looks like it will hold up well with use. I suspect I will be ordering many more.
customer_reviews.author: K. Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a Northbooks bullet journal for the last two years and it's survived the general college environment, a summer working at a sleepaway camp, and a semester abroad. The cover stands up surprisingly well despite the serious beating I've given it. The paper is thick enough not to let ink show between pages but still light enough to be convenient for journaling. The dotted grid is consistent from page to page. I've just ordered a new one because I can't imagine using anything else anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Simple glue bound notebook
customer_reviews.text: This is a great notebook with grid paper. The spine is glued with no paper perforations so you have to be careful if you are removing pages. The paper writes well and doesn't easily bleed. If you're planning on keeping a log or final drafts of diagrams etc, this is a fine notebook.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Affordable quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a great price! Pages are durable and even the heavy handed liquid ink doesn't bleed through. Working with cover, and the spine to break in, both sides lay flat, even with only a minute amount of pages used. And the cover doesn't bow out after being broken in. Only 15 pages in and I am already considering buying a 2nd and a 3rd. Loving it!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. M.

customer_reviews.title: Stand apart with this unique and sleek notebook.
customer_reviews.text: As a notebook connoisseur - I was so excited to get these Northbooks notebooks in the mail this week. They are sleek looking, well crafted, perfect paper stock/weight and size - and all-around awesome! If you're looking for a notebook that sets you apart from the usual suspects...give this new company a chance. You won't be disappointed. I'm just glad they came as a two-pack because I'm sure I'll fill the first one up soon. Thanks for making a great product!
customer_reviews.author: T. Fanning

customer_reviews.title: Lovely for a bullet journal
customer_reviews.text: I started with the standard brown, lined northbooks. I switched to this style and size for bullet journaling. Paper weight is great with no bleed through from fine line markers. Size is good too. Only 4 stars because the dot printing is not consistent throughout the journal but it's only off by a few mm and is generally a group of connected pages printed the same. So only every few are noticeably different. Will be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Denney

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy journals and this one is affordable and great for taking on the go. I used to be afraid of bullet journaling but I love that it includes lists, decorating, charting, and anything else you want to include.
customer_reviews.author: SaraB

customer_reviews.title: A great find!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the feel on the notebook. The cover is a nice soft one but thicker than the pages. The last couple of pages can be torn out. Has a little ghosting but nothing major. All the pens looked nice on the page to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bullet journaling and drawing!
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for starting my first bullet journal! Long how easy it is to use. Very highly would recommend and plan to get another when I fill this one up!
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette M.

customer_reviews.title: Great sketchbook!
customer_reviews.text: I have order this sketch book a few times. It’s a pleasure to fill up with doodles. I love the feel of it, light and sleek.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Provan

customer_reviews.title: Northbooks had what I was looking for and I am happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a notebook for bullet journaling that had dotted gridlines and was reasonably priced. Northbooks had what I was looking for and I am happy with my purchase. There is no bleed-through, but as another customer mentioned there is some very faint shadowing (I use Staedtler Triplus Fineliners to write in my notebook). I find that the pages are perfect for its use and is not too thick and not too thin. The book is very lightweight and simple, but I cannot speak for its durability as I have had it for only a month. Overall, I am very happy with Northbooks and will most likely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: yayforyvette

customer_reviews.title: Great for bullet journal
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my first attempt at a bullet journal. I liked the soft cover and the color (although I do feel like it shows fingerprints). It is holding up really well so far and once you use it a bit the cover has no problem staying open. I would say the only thing that would make it better is pre-numbered pages!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Brookhaus

customer_reviews.title: Nice little notebooks
customer_reviews.text: Nice little notebooks - solid paper cover and a glued binding of stitched signatures. Lays flat nicely. I use them at work for meeting notes. I've tried several different kinds of pens - the paper is great quality and even my wettest fountain pens don't bleed through. Also nice with roller ball and heavy pencil. The more I use these, the more I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Randall S. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Good quality journal refills
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of very nice sturdy journal covers I want to reuse. These refills are a good fit and the quality is very good. They would also do well on their own, I think.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Webb

customer_reviews.title: Cover not the same as the dotted notebook
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased the dotted notebook and loved the soft feel of the cover. So I decided to purchase the two pack of plain notebooks. The cover on these is completely different, just stiff paper, and one has bent corners from shipping. Kind of disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mylostlenore

customer_reviews.title: Perforated pages are seemingly random.
customer_reviews.text: Paper quality is good and the spine folds back easily. Random pages are perforated for some reason, which tells me that the manufacturing process is somewhat sloppy. Might just be a unique defect, but I'm not sure. Kind of ruins the point of having perforated pages, as you have to hunt them down if you want to tear one out. It'd be better if you could just flip to the back if you wanted a loose sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP cover.
customer_reviews.text: The problem is the cover! I bought this last year and really liked how the cover felt (slightly "waxed"). It didn't over crease from holding it down to write in the journal. The new cover feels CHEAP! It's just a little thicker paper feeling. You can tell it wont hold up for a year...like my last years. The lines and inside paper is great, but it wont last with that cover. ( 1st pic on the left is the cheap cover, on the right is the old one. 2nd cheap on is on the bottom)
customer_reviews.author: DJ  C

customer_reviews.title: This is a great, USA made product that really proves that you ...
customer_reviews.text: Proof that a notebook is not just a notebook. Very well made, so far, none of my pens have bled through including the felt tip Papermate. This has been a pleasure to use and I may just be a convert for life. This is a great, USA made product that really proves that you indeed get what you pay for. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Halinator

customer_reviews.title: Love this book
customer_reviews.text: Love this book! The cover is soft but not too floppy. The paper is thick enough that, unless I put several layers of color on a single spot, I don't get bleed through. Customer service is also outstanding. The only reason I don't give a full five stars is that the dots are not aligned exactly the same on each page. They aren't crooked, but the horizontal alignment of the columns is a bit different from page to page.
customer_reviews.author: Sarahstl

customer_reviews.title: Solid Binding
customer_reviews.text: My wife has used this book for almost everything since she got it for organizing her daily activities. This book is nice and sturdy and the binding is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Questriot

customer_reviews.title: Perfect all over
customer_reviews.text: High quality notebooks that fit easily into an inner pocket of my shoulder bag. Don't let the softcover deter you from buying this sturdy bullet journal. This is my third purchase of these because I use them for everything!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Nelsen

customer_reviews.title: High Quality 90GSM Dot Notebooks. Good alternative to Rhodia.
customer_reviews.text: High quality notebooks with good 90 GSM pages that really hold up against even the heaviest wet fountain pens. Love these notebooks as they are a great value and alternative to Rhodia. See some writing examples on the notepad below.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Yu

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and useful
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Sturdy and useful. Hadn't noticed if description pointed this out, but the last several pages are perforated for easy removal. I didn't want that, but someone might. I'd order again! Only improvement I'd suggest is numbered pages.
customer_reviews.author: buyitall

customer_reviews.title: Great Notebook!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great notebook. I really love the dot ruling, so you can make any page whatever you want. The cover has a nice texture to it, kind of grippy and smooth at the same time. I like that the spine is sewn so once it's broken in, the book will be able to lay flat. I've only used Pilot G2's 0.38mm pens in them and I've had zero issues with bleeding or smearing. The books have a few perforated pages at the back, but the rest are not. It's an overall great notebook.
customer_reviews.author: motojunkie

customer_reviews.title: High quality simple design notebook
customer_reviews.text: These notebooks are shading quality and sewn bindings so they don't fall apart. The dot pattern is subtle giving you the freedom to use the page any way you want, whether that's lined writing it sketching a quick drawing. This will be my go to from this point on. Bonus for me...Made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Not at all fountain pen friendly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as alternative to rhodia. But pages are not at all suitable for fountain pens. Page quality does not justify it's price.
customer_reviews.author: dev

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Journals
customer_reviews.text: My absolutely favorite journals for just about anything honestly. Quality is great. Bleed through is decent. Just a fantastic book.
customer_reviews.author: The Lazer Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was searching for!
customer_reviews.text: So far these books have been great. The quality is good and the paper is nice. I plan on buying them again when I'm looking for more notebooks. I appreciate that they're made in USA, which is hard to find in a journal or notebook. In fact, it's the reason I purchased a couple in the first place. Even Walmart is making this style of journals now days, but for the same price and much better quality I can get them made in USA and from a small company. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Friend

customer_reviews.title: Quality little notebook made in the USA! Great for UI sketching.
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, I love that it's made in the USA. I always prefer to buy and use products made in the USA by American workers. With that said, it's a quality notebook that fits my needs perfectly. It's works perfectly as a sketch pad for UI designs and page layouts. I'll be coming back for more.
customer_reviews.author: Jak

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, pages fall out easily
customer_reviews.text: This notebook is bound by some kind of thread and my pages keep falling out. It is super low quality and if you spread the spine too thin, the pages just come right now. Spend the few extra bucks to get moleskin!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The colors great and the cover seems to be holding up pretty ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I am really liking this notebook. The colors great and the cover seems to be holding up pretty well. I love the dot grid and the off white color of the pages. You can smooth it out so it lies pretty flat and is easy to write in. When I fill this one up I will definitely be ordering another. It came quicker than expected too.
customer_reviews.author: Kiev Fehnel

customer_reviews.title: Paper quality not made for fountain pens.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, I have an obsession with writing with fountain pens, but in this notebooks I have to use either a Sharpie pen or some other non-feathering pen. Other than that, little to no bleeding, only feathering of liquid when I use a fountain pen. The book itself does not stay open, you have to push always one side down in order to write.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Arrived used???
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, as described, but the first few pages were soiled and stained. That is the reason for the three stars. My daughter was disappointed as it looked used.
customer_reviews.author: Capview

product_meta.title: Northbooks USA Bullet Dotted Notebook | A5 Journal No Bleed Through Premium Recycled Cream Paper | Classic Bound Note Books for Bullet Journaling, Travel, Office, Personal | 5.8 x 8.2 inch Made in USA
feature_bullets: BULLET JOURNAL You'll love this dotted grid notebook bullet journaling, personal or work journal
NO BLEED THROUGH on 90gsm thick premium acid free archival quality dotted graph paper notebook
USA These bullet journals are designed, sustainably sourced, and 100% made in the USA.
VERSATILE USE: Great for daily bullet journaling, sketching and taking notes at home or the office
SOFT, STURDY COVER: The simple yet elegant covers use 30% recycled paper and are thicker for durability

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars899 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
